abstract: Both Microsoft and Google are essentially one-trick ponies that have used their prodigious cash flows to pursue side projects. The economic climate is reining in these efforts.
snippet: Both Microsoft and Google are essentially one-trick ponies that have used their prodigious cash flows to pursue side projects. The economic climate is reining in these efforts.

byline.original: By Jeff Segal and Martin Hutchinson

abstract: Google and Microsoft have begun reining in their sideline investments, and Breakingviews suggests that their other noncore projects should be next.
snippet: Google and Microsoft have begun reining in their sideline investments, and Breakingviews suggests that their other noncore projects should be next.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft and Google have more in common than the dominance of their respective markets, says Breakingviews.

headline.main: Yard Sales for Google and Microsoft?

abstract: Stock markets clipped their losses in afternoon trading but were still trading in the red as investors grappled with disappointing news from Microsoft and the housing market.
snippet: Stock markets clipped their losses in afternoon trading but were still trading in the red as investors grappled with disappointing news from Microsoft and the housing market.
lead_paragraph: A day after stock markets posted their biggest one-day advance in weeks, they made an about-face on Thursday. The major indexes gave back close to half their gains, finishing sharply lower as investors grappled with a blast of disappointing news from Microsoft and the housing market.

headline.main: Shares Slide as Grim News Keeps the Markets on Edge
headline.print_headline: Shares Slide as Grim News Keeps the Markets on Edge

abstract: With sales of PCs falling, Microsoft said it would lay off 5 percent of its work force, and warned that technology spending could wane for years to come.
snippet: With sales of PCs falling, Microsoft said it would lay off 5 percent of its work force, and warned that technology spending could wane for years to come.
lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. — With sales of computers deteriorating by the day, the PC industry’s dominant players — Microsoft and Intel — have arrived at the stark realization that the slump in sales could last a long time, perhaps years.

headline.main: Microsoft Slashes Jobs as Sales Fall
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Slashes Jobs As Sales Fall

abstract: Microsoft says the next version of its cellphone software will move data like photos and contacts between phones, computers and the Internet.
snippet: Microsoft says the next version of its cellphone software will move data like photos and contacts between phones, computers and the Internet.
lead_paragraph: “Automagicly” is a word that Andrew Lees seems to use a great deal more than most people.

headline.main: Can Windows Mobile Get the Magic Back?

abstract: David Pogue reviews an early version of Microsoft's latest operating system, Windows 7.
snippet: David Pogue reviews an early version of Microsoft's latest operating system, Windows 7.
lead_paragraph: David Pogue reviews an early version of Microsoft's latest operating system, Windows 7.
